item.title: Litter & Railings, 30th January
item.description:
There is a nasty litter issue around this area that could use attention. Also, there is a wooden post metal railing here which has been clearly damaged (the railing is hanging loose).
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elmers End, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Car abandoned, 30th January
item.description:
Car has been parked on road for several weeks now and not moved. In good condition - not sure if it has been dumped or is not running? Parked away from curb. During busy times, due to how it is parked can cause limitations on parking.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Paget Rise, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unauthorised shed blocking access and bin storage, 30th January
item.description:
A shed has been erected in a communal area blocking access to the bin storage area and blocking access to the back garden, The shed is near my property and has not been given permission by the council or housing association. The shed is on common land
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Crusoe Mews, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Race Flyposting, 30th January
item.description:
10 flyposters on traffic lights. Half of which are obstructing viability for pedestrians at crossing. Please remove as my partner caught the the poster and was threatened with assault.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Newington Butts, Elephant and Castle, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned Trailer in street Dimsdale Drive by near bus stop, 30th January
item.description:
The trailer has identifying marks to identify owners, has flat tyres and appears abandoned it has been there for months without being moved.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 27, Dimsdale Drive, Southbury, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unused disabled bay, 30th January
item.description:
Good day, and hope this finds the correct department, as I could not find anything more suitable! There is a disabled bay outside number 1 Budleigh Crescent, which I have not seen anyone using for more than a year at least. Parking is very limited around here as it is, and I wondered if, since it was not being used, could it be removed and provide a much needed extra space to park? many thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Budleigh Crescent, East Wickham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Massive pothole under Manor Road bridge, 30th January
item.description:
This could seriously damage anyone on 2 wheels

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Wall collapsing onto pavement, 30th January
item.description:
Tree has grown too big and pushed fencing / wall out of place causing soil and wall to fall on to the pavement causing possible safety hazard. Also area is untidy with rubbish everywhere.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Silverdale, Forest Hill, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned van restricting view of oncoming traffic, 30th January
item.description:
The van has been here for well over a week. It is parked half on half off the kerb in an area where only full on road parking is permitted. It is blocking the view from my drive making it extremely difficult for me to pull out of my drive or reverse in. It's close to the junction of St pauls wood hill and its dangerous trying to pull out if a car comes round, as I can't check both ways because of restricted view.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 50, Breakspears Drive, St Paul's Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement, 29th January
item.description:
Southwood road pavement both sides still not been swept??? Sent road sweeper down the middle of the road again but no one gets out and cleans the pavement?? Two schools in this street and the children have to walk through this?

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Woolf Close, Thamesmead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Mattress, rubbish bag dumped on Tabard Street, 29th January
item.description:
There is a mattress, rubbish bag and mop dumped at the tree on Tabard street. It has been there for seven days.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tabard Street, The Borough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large pothole, 29th January
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 149, Sidcup Hill, North Cray, Greater London
